transcript: Pierre had dropped; the doctors became re- spectfully silent as he passed by, and moved to make way for him. At first Pierre wished to take another seat so as not to trouble the lady, and also to pick up the glove himself and to pass round the doctors who were not even in his way; but all at once he felt that this would not do, and that tonight he was a person o- bliged to perform some sort of awful rite which everyone expected of him, and that he was therefore bound to accept their servic
